results.content: I learned a lot so far!

The author seems to create project examples on the fly, very often tweaking the example as he goes along. Additionally, the flow of information is very jagged and hard to follow. It goes like this: 

the author begins to explain something like PHP class
he starts writing the class
abruptly stops and reshuffles the files in the directory
sometimes creates new files 
goes back to writing the class
stops and mentions something not important to the lecture 
and tells that he's going to touch on that in the next lecture
reshuffles the example
aaand something works.

At that point, it's completely irrelevant what exactly happened because you start to miss the whole thing because of the abrupt flow.

Author, please stick to the topic of the lecture, don't drift away into blunter and meaningless offtopic. Have your example prepared on a separate screen and execute it from start to finish. Explain what happened along the way in a simple manner and don't mention 1001 detail about why you're placing curly braces in the way you do. Explain why the current topic is important and give a short example of how is going to be utilized.
